row.name: PCK.AUTOMIC_AZURE.PUB.ACTION.DELETE_BLOB
row.description: Delete an existing Blob from Storage Container in Azure

row.Docu:
= Action name = PCK.AUTOMIC_AZURE.PUB.ACTION.DELETE_BLOB
= General description = This action is used to delete the blob or its snapshots or both as per the specified inputs from Storage container in Microsoft Azure.
There are 3 different ways in which a user can provide the value for 'Snapshot' input and the corresponding behavior is as follows : * If snapshot's date-time format is entered, it will delete the given snapshot only. * If empty, it will delete the blob along with its associated snapshot(s) if exists. * If a "*" is entered, it will delete the snapshots but not the blob.
= Inputs = * Account Name : Storage account name length: 3 to 24 characters, numbers and lowercase letters only. Example mystorage123 * Access Key : Access key for this storage account * Container Name : Storage container name length: 3 to 63 characters, numbers, lower-case letters and - only. Dash (-) must be immediately preceded and followed by a letter or number * Blob Name : Blob name should not end with [.] or [/]. Should not contain [\]. Max Length 1024 characters. * Snapshot : Snapshot of the blob in the date-time format (Example 2011-03-09T01:42:34.9360000Z) or * to remove all the snapshots but not the blob. * Lease ID : Provide lease ID if blob has an active lease. * Overwrite Agent : Overwrites the default agent * Overwrite Login : Overwrites the default login
= Behavior = * If a blob has a large number of snapshots, it's possible that the Delete Blob operation will time out. If this happens, user should retry the request. * If a blob does not have snapshots and you want to delete the snapshots, the action will fail. * If an invalid container/blob name is supplied in the input, the action will fail.
=Return Value= (none)
= Outputs = * Return code is 0 in case of success. * Return code is 1 in case of failure. * Return code is 2 in case of connection timed out !!
= Rollback = (none)
= Logging = AE logs will be displayed in the AE report. Java logs will be created at \temp\azure.log under agent installation directory.
= Example = (none)
